question: Section 202 07 (c)
sols_html:
The only interior point is \((1,0)\). This condition can be written as:

\[\begin{aligned} p_1'(1) &= p_2'(1)\\ p_2''(1) &= p_2'(1)\end{aligned}\]

with

\(p_1'(x)=3a_1x^2+2b_1x+c_1\Rightarrow p_1'(1)=3a_1+2b_1+c_1\)

\(p_2'(x)=3a_2(x-1)^2+2b_2(x-1)+c_2\Rightarrow p_2'(1)=0+0+c_2\)

and the second derivatives:

\(p_1''(x)=6a_1x+2b_1\Rightarrow p_1''(1)=6a_1+2b_1\)

\(p_2''(x)=6a_2(x-1)+2b_2 \Rightarrow p_2''(1)=2b_2\)

The equations are therefore:

\[\begin{aligned} 3a_1+2b_1+c_1 &= c_2\\ 6a_1+2b_1 &= 2b_2\end{aligned}\]

statement_html:
We want to interpolate through (0, 1), (1, 0), (2, 2) using cubic splines

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \begin{cases} p_1(x), & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\ p_2(x), & 1 \leq x \leq 2 \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

(c) Interior derivative must be continuous. Write down the linear equations expressing this condition.
